title: 1st Line Support Engineer
description:
1st Line Support – Hybrid working.

Office Location: Leicester

Working hours: Monday to Friday 09.00: 17.00 (One day per week in office)

Salary: £21,000 - £22,000

Could this be the role for you?

  • Have you worked in a customer facing role, assisting people with any technical issues they might be having?
  • Are you someone who is very technically minded who can relay information in a way that people will understand.
  • Maybe you have some sort of IT qualification and are looking to begin your service desk career?

The opportunity:

Our client, a forward-thinking software business based in Leicester are looking for a 1st Line support Analyst to join their team. You will be a point of contact for their customers, assisting them with technical issues relating to the software and hardware they are using. You will also assist them with any requests they have, such as amendments to their software packages or accounts.

Customers will contact you via email or live chat to explain their issue, so in this role you won’t be talking call after call. From time to time, you may need to make a few outbound calls to your customers to gain further information, or to update them on the progress of their request.

Benefits:

  • As 1st Line Support, you will benefit from hybrid working. You will need to live within a commutable distance to travel into the office in Leicester, one day per week.
  • 25 days holiday + bank holidays.
  • Company Laptop and Phone.

Responsibilities of the 1st Line Support Executive:

  • Working to targeted ticket closures per day (30 minimum).
  • Responding to customer queries.
  • Managing information on the system and ensuring accuracy.
  • Assess customer issues and requirements and be reactive whether that means picking up the phone to assist or responding via email/live chat.
  • Escalate issues internally when required.
  • Keep up to date with software changes.
  • Be aware of ticket trends and reoccurring significant issues.
  • Meet performance KPI’s.

The Candidate:

  • Previous experience in a customer facing role where you have provided some sort of technical support to people.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Ability to understand technical problems and explain them using non-technical language.
  • Customer service skills.
  • Excellent telephone manner.

Does this role sound like you? Click apply today.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £21,000.00-£22,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Free parking
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Leicester, LE19 1SA

title: Warehouse Lead
description:
No matter where you are in your career – or where you want to be – we’re here to create a great place to work where you can grow, perform and love what you do. At Cromwell, we’re all individuals, with unique backgrounds and personalities. But we have one thing in common: delivering exceptional service for our customers. And we do this through our purpose of Keeping Industry Working.

Role Responsibilities:

Cromwell Tools is seeking an Analyst Team Leader to join our Finance department in Wigston, Leicester. In this elevated role, you will report to the Head of FP&A and lead a team of Analysts. You will coach and train Analysts within the team, working on analytics to support big business decisions and putting insights in the hands of the teams that need it. Your primary focus will be on ensuring the delivery of high-quality data feeds, insights, and analytics, while maintaining a single source of truth for data within the organisation. Proficiency in SQL-based systems, particularly PostgreSQL, is preferred.
Key Responsibilities:

  • Team Leadership: Lead and mentor a team of Data Analysts, fostering their growth, and ensuring they meet individual and team goals.
  • Collaborate with other Analysts and the Data Science team Working together on larger data projects as well as supporting the immediate business needs.
  • Information Requests: Manage and prioritise day-to-day requests for data and information from various departments within the organisation, ensuring timely and accurate responses.
  • Legacy Reporting Systems: Oversee the decommissioning of legacy reporting systems, working with the team to migrate relevant data and reports to more efficient platforms.
  • Data Quality: Establish and maintain data quality standards and processes to ensure the accuracy and reliability of data feeds and reports.
  • Single Source of Truth: Ensure that data used across the organisation is consistent and aligns with a single instance of truth, reducing data discrepancies.
  • Coaching and Training: Coach and train analysts within the business to enhance their analytical skills and understanding of data practices.
  • Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT, to identify opportunities for improving data management and reporting processes.

Preferred skills and qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field (Master's preferred).
  • Proven experience in data analysis and team leadership roles.
  • Proficiency in data visualisation tools, with expertise in Power BI.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to prioritise and manage multiple tasks and projects.
  • Knowledge of data governance and data quality best practices.
  • Experience with SQL-based systems, particularly PostgreSQL, is a plus.
  • Experience with data migration and legacy system decommissioning is a plus.

About Cromwell

Cromwell has been around for over 50 years, supplying an unrivalled choice of cutting tools, power tools, hand tools and safety equipment into all industries, professions and trades. We offer next day delivery or collection from our nationwide branch network, supported by an overnight UK logistics operation. Our team of over 1500 people are proud to be keeping industry working.

As a leader in B2B and B2C e-commerce, our Digital team is responsible for driving digital multi-channel solutions that make it easy for customers to deal with us.

Our Agile teams make data-driven decisions to ensure that our customers receive the biggest benefits, more frequently. You’ll have the freedom and autonomy to try new things, challenge the status quo and embrace curiosity.

And our data team, comprised of awesome data analysts, data engineers and data scientists, is leading the data landscape within Cromwell, building creative solutions and delivering key insights and valued reporting.

We’re all individuals, yet we’re very much one united team. We treat everyone fairly – regardless of gender, sexual orientation, background, age or disability – and give everyone opportunities for new and varied experiences. Inclusion means not just accepting people for who they are, but showing respect and making adjustments to help people and remove all barriers; it’s about creating a culture where everyone is respected, empowered and able to realise their full potential.

Cromwell is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Delivery Manager
description:
Do you have a passion for data and enjoy turning it into insights that drive business decisions? Are you a highly organised individual with excellent communication and project management skills? If so, then this Reporting and Metrics
Delivery Manager role may be perfect for you!
We are seeking a highly motivated team member with a strong passion for data-driven decision making and process improvement. In this role, you will be responsible for leading the development and implementation of a comprehensive reporting and metrics program for our delivery teams. You will work closely with collaborators across the organisation to identify key performance indicators, build dashboards and reports, and leverage data insights to optimise project delivery, resource allocation, and overall operational efficiency. You will also be responsible for creating and delivering insightful reports and presentations that communicate complex data to a variety of audiences.

Responsibilities:

Collect, analyse, and interpret data:
  • Oversee the collection of data from various sources, including project management tools, systems, and financial reports.
  • Conduct regular data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement.
  • Translate complex data into clear and actionable insights for customers.
Develop and deliver insightful reports:
  • Create tailored reports and dashboards for different audiences, including senior management, project teams, and clients.
  • Develop standardised reporting templates and processes to ensure data consistency and accuracy.
  • Choose and configure reporting and data visualisation tools for effective communication of insights.
  • Explain data findings and present recommendations in a clear, concise, and compelling manner. Use storytelling techniques to transform data into actionable narratives.
Drive continuous improvement:
  • Regularly evaluate the effectiveness of the reporting and metrics program and find opportunities for improvement.
  • Collaborate with team members to refine critical metrics and reporting processes based on evolving needs.
  • Proactively share data insights and recommendations to optimize project delivery and overall performance.
Manage and motivate a team (optional):
  • If applicable, lead and mentor a team of reporting analysts or data specialists.
  • Cultivate a data-driven culture within the organization by providing training and support.
  • Delegate tasks effectively and hold team members accountable for their contributions.
Qualifications:
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in project management or a related field.
  • Proven track record of developing and implementing reporting and metrics programs.
  • Strong analytical skills and experience with data visualisation tools.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Proficiency in MS Office Suite, project management software, and data analysis tools.
  • Experience with Agile methodologies preferred.
Additional desired skills:
  • Experience with continuous improvement methodologies.
  • Understanding of data warehousing and business intelligence concepts.
  • Strong collaborator management skills.
LSEG is a leading global financial markets infrastructure and data provider. Our purpose is driving financial stability, empowering economies and enabling customers to create sustainable growth.
Our purpose is the foundation on which our culture is built. Our values of Integrity, Partnership, Excellence and Change underpin our purpose and set the standard for everything we do, every day. They go to the heart of who we are and guide our decision making and everyday actions.
Working with us means that you will be part of a dynamic organisation of 25,000 people across 65 countries. However, we will value your individuality and enable you to bring your true self to work so you can help enrich our diverse workforce. You will be part of a collaborative and creative culture where we encourage new ideas and are committed to sustainability across our global business. You will experience the critical role we have in helping to re-engineer the financial ecosystem to support and drive sustainable economic growth. Together, we are aiming to achieve this growth by accelerating the just transition to net zero, enabling growth of the green economy and creating inclusive economic opportunity.
LSEG offers a range of tailored benefits and support, including healthcare, retirement planning, paid volunteering days and wellbeing initiatives.
We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. This means that we do not discriminate on the basis of anyone’s race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. Conforming with applicable law, we can reasonably accommodate applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs.

title: Digital Analyst
description:
Paul Smith is one of Britain’s leading independent design companies. We champion positivity, curiosity, and creativity. These qualities underpin every Paul Smith design, whether it’s a shirt, a shop, or a special collaboration. Reaffirming the values that Paul set down in 1970, ‘classic with a twist’ remains the guiding principle of the company. Happily, positioned between high fashion and formalwear, while taking reference from both, Paul Smith has always been proud to stand apart.

We are looking for a Junior Digital Analyst to work on new Digital initiatives to support the business on driving sales and growing performance. Analyse data to draw a clear and relevant conclusion with actionable insights. Focus on producing insights and analysis from various data sources that help inform decision making.

The Role:
  • Compile and analyse regular reports for specific territories and markets, ensuring accuracy and validity in the data.
  • Process and analyse datasets in Microsoft Excel using functions such as lookups and pivot tables etc. to produce recommendations and findings for various stakeholders across the organisation.
  • Work closely with senior team members to interpret data and contribute to data-driven decision-making processes.
  • Build and maintain dashboards for the digital department to measure key performance indicators and work towards targets.
  • Handle large datasets and implement the use visualisations tools such as Power BI.
  • Proactively analyse data on from Google analytics and our CRM platform to report on product, consumer, and geographical trends to maximise sales opportunities.
  • Collaborate with our digital marketing stakeholders to ensure data, insight and analytics drive continuous optimisation and improvement.
  • Analyse and provide regular insight in all aspects of the digital journey to pull out trends and report on performance to improve the conversion rate of key customer journeys and digital channels.
Your Skills and Experience:
  • A strong analytical approach with excellent knowledge of Excel and PowerPoint.
  • Experience and a keen interest in customer and web insights to inform commercial decisions.
  • Experience of analysing data and producing comprehensive and informative reports using Excel.
  • Ability to plan, organise and prioritise.
  • Ability to liaise with third parties on a regular basis.
Who you are:
  • Have a keen interest in the commercial and strategic needs of the business and can use this to accurately judge and advise on business priorities.
  • Accurate, methodical, and numerate.
  • Team worker who can work using their own initiative.
  • Trustworthy with confidential information.
  • Reliable and confident.
  • Motivated, helpful, can stay calm under pressure and be self-motivated.
What’s in it for you:
  • A generous clothing allowance.
  • Discretionary discount on PSL goods.
  • An annual leave entitlement of 25 days, plus Bank Holidays.
  • Pension Scheme.
  • Hybrid working.
  • Cycle to work and travel loan schemes.

At Paul Smith, we celebrate and encourage applications from all walks of life into our growing workforce. We are committed to empowering people from any background, belief system, or ethnicity, offering an inclusive environment where talent is recognised and valued.

At LEVC we have been transformed from a traditional vehicle manufacturer of the iconic black cab, into a modern electric vehicle company with high performing tech. About the role

The IT Support Analyst & Office 365 Lead will provide 1st & 2nd line support and additionally, take a lead in the O365 User Administrator duties. Responsible for providing technical support and maintaining the efficient operation of our information technology systems, with a focus on O365 administration, including SharePoint, Exchange Server, and Active Directory. You will serve as the first point of contact for all IT-related issues and play a critical role in ensuring the smooth functioning of our technology infrastructure. This role requires technical, communication and collaboration skills, to work effectively with both business and IT Teams.

Help design and drive O365 strategy and usage across the company.

Take a lead role in O365, administering user accounts, permissions, and access rights for including SharePoint, Exchange Server, and Active Directory.

Provide 1st& 2nd line support for all IT-related issues and inquiries from employees across the organization

Document and maintain accurate records of support requests, resolutions, and system configurations


Experience to succeed


Relevant experience in a 1st & 2ndline computer & associated service role

ITIL v4 Foundation desirable

Good communication skills

Microsoft accreditation in Windows 10/11 &/or Office 365 are desirable

Experienced supporting a sizeable, fast-moving business

Knowledge and experience in the fields of collaborative services, especially the configuration & optimisation of smart devices/mobile computing, video conferencing systems & printing


What we can offer you

Competitive salary


25 days’ annual leave plus bank holidays


Life insurance, cycle to work scheme, and a salary sacrifice pension scheme

description:
Description

Based in Nottingham, we are looking to expand our Billing Team due to continued success & growth and have created an exciting opportunity for an experienced Billing Analyst, ensuring an excellent standard of service is provided and maintained to our Yü Energy customers.

It would be desirable if you had energy industry experience, but this is not essential. Our company is growing at a rapid pace so it’s an exciting opportunity to join an organisation which can offer a longterm future career.

Passionate and motivated people are the power behind our growth so we’re looking to expand our team and you could be part of our success story.
*
What We Need from Yü*
*
Here’s a taste of what you’ll be doing:*

  • Resolving specific customer accounts within agreed service level agreements
  • Supporting end to end delivery of designated Billing Portfolio.
  • Support maintenance & smooth running of Billing Systems.
  • Working through System exceptions to resolve billing queries.
  • Account set up of large customer multisites in billing system for group billing.
  • Working alongside other departments to resolve complex billing queries i.e. Metering/Industry/Data Exceptions.
  • Liaise with External agents to resolve complex Industry/Billing exceptions.
  • Assisting technical Leads with producing billing statistics to report to Line manager.
  • Coordination of Billing tasks to ensure weekly/monthly targets are met.
  • Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple deadlines.
  • To be able to build effective inter-departmental working relationships.
  • Be flexible and a strong team player, as the role will develop over time.
  • Highlighting process improvements and supporting team to drive change.
  • UAT testing of system upgrades/bugs and new software.
  • Experience in dealing with DC/DC/MOP & DNO is desirable.
  • Exposure to industry Data flows with a good understanding of industry interaction is also desirable.

About Yü
*
If you have what it takes you could be just what we’re looking for…*

  • Sharp – Effective decision-making skills to manage technical workload.
  • Experienced – you’ve preferably worked in the energy/metering industry.
  • Great communicator – you have first-rate communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ambitious – you don’t just want another job, you want a career opportunity.
  • Analytical – naturally curious, immaculate attention to detail.
  • Motivated – you have a “can do” attitude and love to see success.
  • Team player – you enjoy working closely with a team to help them develop.
  • Flexible – you’re a strong team player who can adapt as the role and business develops.

Yü Come First
*
We have a wide range of benefits for our employees including:*

  • 24 days annual leave + bank holidays
  • Holiday buy – up to 5 additional days
  • Day off on your birthday
  • Employee Assistance Programme
  • Annual salary review
  • Learning and development opportunities
  • Enhanced paternity, maternity and adoption policies
  • Yü made a difference Awards
  • Travel Loan Scheme
  • 3 days additional annual leave if you get married/civil partnership etc.
  • Appointment allowance
  • Long service recognition
  • Refer a friend payment
  • Company sick pay (subject to length of service)
  • New modern facilities
  • Death in service and critical illness cover
  • Plus, many more

#YUIndeed

If you need any reasonable adjustments to help you apply for a role, please let us know and we will see what we can do.
*
About Yü Group*
Yü Energy are one of the UK’s fastest growing business gas, electricity and water suppliers, supplying thousands of companies across the UK.
On a mission to shake-up the UK business energy market, our winning combination of expert, personal service and competitive prices are specifically tailored to the needs of commercial customers.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £23,000.00-£25,000.00 per year

title: Senior Test Engineer
description:
An opportunity has arisen for a talented QA Engineer/Software Test Analyst with experience in both manual and automation testing to join our successful development team based in Loughborough.

\n

Who are we looking for?

\n

The an experienced candidate in developing test strategies and preparing test plans and scripts, including those required for automated testing.

\n

You must have:

\n

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills * Comfortable interacting with both technical and non-technical colleagues * Able to understand business requirements and processes * Plan, design, deliver and maintain test plans * Analyse and communicate test results * Prioritise and manage defects * Input into project planning and design with a view to optimising quality

\n

Desirable Up-to-date knowledge of industry standards and automated test tools

\n

Duties include:

\n

* Undertake all system test related activities in support of the business requirements for the provision of new and updated systems, including functional and integration testing, liaison with customers to ensure appropriate test coverage. * To help provide 2nd line product support, including raising and tracking bugs including retesting * Ensure that test scenarios and scripts are prepared in a structured way, prioritised to reflect business or technical priorities and are approved by appropriate stakeholders. Including test cycle contents and regression packs. * Create allocated test scripts, monitor test execution and ensure results are recorded. Co-ordinate the re-testing of defects and issues through to resolution. * Prepare and maintain relevant test documentation, including test scripts, activity schedules, narrative and written reports, and visual progress charts. * Ensure high quality and accuracy is maintained through to software release. * Provide feedback to the development team and ensure the work is carried out in accordance with the schedule and the quality requirements. * Provide accurate estimates and feedback for project scheduling purposes.

\n

What’s in it for you?

\n

On offer is a salary package above the market rate with holiday and bonuses, with a huge potential for progression in a company that has realistic aims to be the number 1 provider in its field. Other benefits includes company pension. You will benefit from joining a company that offers a flexible approach to working and one which can offer you a clearly defined career path as well as the opportunity to gain exposure to emerging technologies. On a daily basis, on offer are refreshments as well as weekly team lunches. On site gym, free On-site parking is available and you will also have your own Herman Miller chair.

\n

About the company

\n

Rated as Top 5 tech company to work for by glassdoor. Vacancy Filler provides recruitment software to education and to businesses across the world, combining all the best recruitment tools, such as posting to job boards, applicant tracking and candidate communication tools, into one simple software suite. We have realistic aims to be the number 1 provider in its field. What makes us truly different from our competitors is the user, candidate and recruitment support we offer our clients. We reduce employers’ need for recruitment agencies as well as streamlining their in-house process to save time, costs and to recruit the very best talent.

\n

title: Software Architect
description:
Express Recruitment are excited to be recruiting on behalf of an innovative and exciting global market leader in the Cyber and Security sectors with an enviable client list in the private and government sectors.

They are looking for a Technical Solutions Architect to join their growing team. This is a client facing role and will involve analysing and advising clients on existing cyber infrastructure and solutions, as well as advising on systems this role will be hands-on configuring and assisting with setup.

This role also offers substantial flexibility with home working and flexible working hours.

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Follow project specification ensuring full comprehension at all times
  • Visit customer site and implement new software applications and hardware such as diodes according to company standards and timescale
  • Work closely with other members of the internal team including technical analysts and project managers
  • Advise clients on how to solve technical and IT problems
  • Attend Sales and Presales meetings acting as a technical subject matter expert
  • Ensure continuous improvement in each project, by looking at new and innovative ways

Skills & Experience

  • Technical background or knowledge of the Solutions Architecture or DevOps Consultancy domains
  • Experience working with AWS/Azure
  • Experience working with Servers or Diodes in some capacity beneficial
  • Experience in the Cyber or Software Security sectors advantageous
  • Stakeholder and relationship building skills
  • Commercial awareness of information security compliance standards, in line with ISO:27001
  • Full UK driving licence

If you know you have the required skills and experience and would like to find out more please apply now!

title: Business Analyst
description:
Summary

Job Reference:
224901BR

Nottingham Support Office

Permanent

37.5 hours per week

Our application process

Junior Business Analyst

About the role:

Operational Analytics team supports the business to make smarter data-based decision. We focus on agile working, continuous improvement and personal development. As the business becomes more focused on data and technology, we evolve too with more complex data utilisation and providing analytics-backed value.

You need to understand the business, their needs and requirements to be able to provide different outputs impacting the bottom line. e.g. Data, Reporting, Analytics, Insight etc. Utilising problem-solving mindset and technical expertise in tools such as Power BI, Azure DataBricks, etc.

Become a subject matter expert for part of the business and support the business with driving change, commercial decisions and drive on customer self-serve capabilities.

  • Work with the business to understand the business and deliver reporting, analytics and insight expectations
  • Build, maintain and manage stakeholder relations across business functions
  • Perform data ETL from various sources / systems into Power BI / Azure DataBricks
  • Working in an Agile manor provide accurate, cross business functions aligned outputs
  • Maintain live infrastructure for data pipeline, reporting and analytics
  • Drive capabilities development while instilling a self-serve culture across business
  • Demonstratable out of the box thinking, Commercial acumen and an eye for opportunities when looking at potential problems

What you’ll need to have:

  • Advanced knowledge and technical experience with Power BI reporting and analytics (along with other MS Packages e.g. Power Automate)
  • Stakeholder relationship management
  • Curious, analytical problem-solving mindset
  • Commercial acumen to understand raw data and present the story as output
  • Experience of organising and setting up data for advanced analytics models
  • Ability to map processes and document data and models/reporting
  • Working knowledge of Azure DataBricks and programming languages like Python, SQL, etc…
  • Be able to simplify and explain, complex technical models and outputs to key business stakeholders

It would be great if you also have:

  • Expertise in other systems / tools such as Alteryx, R, etc..
  • Working knowledge of commercial business areas like Sourcing, Product quality, sustainability, etc..
  • Project management

Hybrid Working:

We offer our Support Office team members a flexible, hybrid working approach based upon empowerment, accountability, care, and trust, which includes a balanced mix of remote and office-based working - this will be discussed with you as part of the application process.

About No7 Beauty Company:

No7 Beauty Company is more than just one voice, we are five iconic brands - No7, Liz Earle, Soap & Glory, Botanics and Sleek MakeUP. We believe in creating the best in beauty for everyone - we’re innovators with a passion for challenging perceptions with ground-breaking products, proven results, and positive impact. We’ve built a reputation on scientific innovation, whilst being environmentally sustainable and socially responsible. We’re an equal opportunity employer and no matter where you work in No7 Beauty Company, you’ll be empowered to be your authentic self - we share a culture where diversity, equity and inclusion are at the centre of everything we do. Join us and together we can achieve more. Find out more here.

Our benefits:

  • Boots Retirement Savings Plan
  • Enhanced maternity/paternity/adoption leave pay
  • Discretionary annual bonus
  • Generous employee discounts

Flexible benefits scheme including discounted gym membership, life assurance, activity passes, holiday buying and much more.

We have a great range of benefits in addition to the above that go beyond salary and offer flexibility to suit you;(all rewards and benefits are subject to change and eligibility). *Please note, any salary estimates given on third-party sites are not provided or endorsed by Boots and may not be accurate.

What’s next:

If your application is successful, our in-house recruitment team will be in touch to arrange an interview and to answer any initial questions you have. If you have not been successful on this occasion, you’ll be notified by email.

We are always open to discussing possible flexible working options and what this may look like for you, including job share and reduced hours. If you require additional support as part of the application and interview process, we are happy to provide reasonable adjustments to help you to be at your best.

#LI-Hybrid

title: Data Analyst
description:
DATA ANALYST APPRENTICE


LET’S CUT STRAIGHT TO IT


Taking care of ‘one of life’s essentials’ – it’s our purpose and we want you to be part of it. Supplying wholesome drinking water, treating wastewater, and recycling this back to the environment responsibly is no mean feat. We serve around 8 million people across the Midlands and Wales and unlike other businesses, our delivery is non-negotiable. It’s a matter of life.

Many of our employees are also our customers, so we truly take pride in what we do! Employing people from across our communities and beyond, Severn Trent is an exciting and inclusive place to work – a place where you can be curious, can be ‘Wonderfully You’ and where you can truly make an impact to our environment, now and for future generations.


LET’S TELL YOU MORE


Apprenticeship Programmes are a great way to earn and learn! Our Apprentice Data Analyst Programme offers the perfect blend of personal and professional development, exposing you to the core of our business. Entering an Apprenticeship scheme with us involves working towards the role of a fully-fledged professional, earning a salary, whilst also being able to maintain a sense of academic achievement. At Severn Trent we provide the perfect mix between hands-on experience and a formal qualification, enabling our apprentices to make a real lasting difference to our customers and communities, not just for now, but far into the future.


You’ll be supported every step of the way, by your line manager and mentor. Responsibilities of businesses are changing rapidly; society increasingly expects that organisations should act responsibly not just to their shareholders but also to their wider stakeholders and the broader community. Working alongside either our Capital Delivery team or Workforce Planning & Optimisation Team, you’ll become a key component of virtually all types of business models where profit and growth are a means to an even greater end, such as protecting the environment and improving societal sustainability. You’ll help to innovate and drive ambitions for change and make these a reality that are embedded and implemented across Severn Trent.


HOW WILL THE PROGRAMME WORK


Standard


Data Analyst


Website

https://www.instituteforapprenticeships.org/apprenticeship-standards/data-analyst-v1-1


Apprenticeship Duration


24 months


Apprenticeship Level


Level 4


Locations


Severn Trent Centre, Coventry, West Midlands CV1 2LZ

Finham, Coventry, West Midlands CV3 6SD

Raynesway, Derby, Derbyshire DE21 7BE


Salary

£17,194


Provider/ F2F or Online

TDM / Online


ENTRY CRITERIA


Based on the level of this Apprenticeship Programme (Level 4 Foundation Degree) we require all candidates to have Level 3 qualifications (A-Levels, BTEC National, NVQ/SVQ Level 3, Level 3 advanced apprenticeship)


ROLE EXPECTATIONS POST APPRENTICESHIP


By the end of this programme, you will take up a Data Analyst role, where you will be able to put your skills to action


WHAT WILL YOU LEARN


  • How to access and analyse data from across the entire business. Using it to update existing dashboards and reports, as well as creating your own to meet any new requirements.
  • How to effectively clean, transform, join and validate data from multiple sources (including solving any problems that arise as part of that). Ensuring your data, visualisations, reports, and any conclusions you draw from them are accurate.
  • How to carry out analysis on key measures such as how effectively a team or project is performing right through to higher level company performance metrics that are reported the water regulatory body OFWAT
  • To build internal relationships that foster buy-in to existing and future initiatives.
  • To understand how to act ethically and how this thought process can be brought into everyday business practices.
  • How to analyse and identify Severn Trent’s opportunities and threats. Escalating any risks within your own team or processes if you find them


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR


We want our employees to care and to have a genuine passion for what we do as a business. We need people who want to make a difference in providing a vital service to our customers, now and for the long-term.

We’d love you to be someone with…


  • A ‘can do’ attitude – willing to get stuck in, take accountability for decisions and actions and who takes pride in their work
  • A love of variety in a role and ability to adapt to a dynamic, fast-paced working environment
  • Ability to quickly prioritise tasks and the initiative to dive head-first into problem solving.
  • No two days are the same on the front line and not every day goes to plan, so you’ll need to be quick on your feet to respond!
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills and enjoy working with multiple teams
  • Ability to analyse and interpret information and effectively communicate this to different team members and audiences
  • Curiosity to learn quickly in a reactive and dynamic working environment


HOW WE’LL REWARD AND CARE FOR YOU IN RETURN


It’s not just a job you’ll get here, you’ll get a career too. We have a range of benefits that reward and recognise great work and award-winning training to ensure you reach your potential. And we’ll also help you play your part in looking after the environment and the community in which we live.

With that in mind, here are just some of our favourite perks that you’ll get being part of the Seven Trent family:


  • 25 days holiday + bank holidays (and the ability to buy/ sell up to 5 days per year)
  • Annual bonus scheme (of up to £1,500, which is subject to eligibility)
  • Leading pension scheme – we will double your contribution (up to 15% when you contribute 7.5%)
  • Sharesave – the chance to buy Severn Trent Plc shares at a discounted rate
  • Dedicated training and development with our Academy
  • Electric vehicle scheme and retail offers
  • Family friendly policies
  • Two paid volunteering days per year


As if that isn’t enough, you’ll receive an annual salary increase whilst you’re on programme and you’ll also get an increase when you move into your first job.


LET’S GO


Apply now to build an amazing career and be part of a brilliant team. We can’t wait to hear from you.


Please note, we don’t require a CV or cover letter to complete your application, the system will ask you for this, but you can just upload a blank document.


  • Roles close on Friday 29th March 2024
  • Check your diary – face to face assessments will run from 7th May – 27th June


To find out more about working with us, search #LifeatSevernTrent on social media.


DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION


At Severn Trent we are passionate about our people. We want to make sure that we continue to foster a more diverse, inclusive, and cohesive culture that represents the communities and customers we serve. We’re making sure we keep up the progress with our wonderful working groups – LGBTQ+, Women in Operations & STEM, Disability and Ethnicity, who help us with our commitments. Find out more about our commitments to Diversity and Inclusion at Severn Trent. Click here to find out more

By the end of this programme, you will take up a Data Analyst role, where you will be able to put your skills to action


WHAT WILL YOU LEARN


  • How to access and analyse data from across the entire business. Using it to update existing dashboards and reports, as well as creating your own to meet any new requirements.
  • How to effectively clean, transform, join and validate data from multiple sources (including solving any problems that arise as part of that). Ensuring your data, visualisations, reports, and any conclusions you draw from them are accurate.
  • How to carry out analysis on key measures such as how effectively a team or project is performing right through to higher level company performance metrics that are reported the water regulatory body OFWAT
  • To build internal relationships that foster buy-in to existing and future initiatives.
  • To understand how to act ethically and how this thought process can be brought into everyday business practices.
  • How to analyse and identify Severn Trent’s opportunities and threats. Escalating any risks within your own team or processes if you find them


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR


We want our employees to care and to have a genuine passion for what we do as a business. We need people who want to make a difference in providing a vital service to our customers, now and for the long-term.

We’d love you to be someone with…


  • A ‘can do’ attitude – willing to get stuck in, take accountability for decisions and actions and who takes pride in their work
  • A love of variety in a role and ability to adapt to a dynamic, fast-paced working environment
  • Ability to quickly prioritise tasks and the initiative to dive head-first into problem solving.
  • No two days are the same on the front line and not every day goes to plan, so you’ll need to be quick on your feet to respond!
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills and enjoy working with multiple teams
  • Ability to analyse and interpret information and effectively communicate this to different team members and audiences

HOW WE’LL REWARD AND CARE FOR YOU IN RETURN


It’s not just a job you’ll get here, you’ll get a career too. We have a range of benefits that reward and recognise great work and award-winning training to ensure you reach your potential. And we’ll also help you play your part in looking after the environment and the community in which we live.

With that in mind, here are just some of our favourite perks that you’ll get being part of the Seven Trent family:


  • 25 days holiday + bank holidays (and the ability to buy/ sell up to 5 days per year)
  • Annual bonus scheme (of up to £1,500, which is subject to eligibility)
  • Leading pension scheme – we will double your contribution (up to 15% when you contribute 7.5%)
  • Sharesave – the chance to buy Severn Trent Plc shares at a discounted rate
  • Dedicated training and development with our Academy
  • Electric vehicle scheme and retail offers
  • Family friendly policies

As if that isn’t enough, you’ll receive an annual salary increase whilst you’re on programme and you’ll also get an increase when you move into your first job.

title: Electronics Engineer
description:
Graduate Electronics Engineer

£31,000 plus £2,000 one off Joining Fee

Coventry

The Recruitment Bunker are recruiting exclusively for a Graduate Electronics Engineer to join our client. The key purpose of the role will be to develop Electronic and Electrical systems and follow specifications from customer requirements.

Company Overview

Our client the Penso Group is a consultancy, manufacturing, and composite company specialising in engineering and design. Penso has developed skills in project and supply chain management with quality systems and processes to deliver complex solutions to the highest standards and is driven by an innovative spirit, renowned for applying state-of-the-art technologies to the automotive, defence, aerospace, rail, and marine sectors.

Overview of the Role

  • Graduate Electronics Engineer
  • Salary - £31,000 plus a £2,000 one off joining fee
  • Holidays: 25 days plus 8 Bank Holidays
  • Pension
  • Healthcare/Life Insurance
  • Location - Coventry

Responsibilities

  • Company Policies: Manage and follow the quality, health, safety, and welfare policies of the company
  • Work Closely as part of the electronics systems team to develop high quality cost effective electronic/electrical systems
  • Develop Electronic and Electrical systems
  • Develop new analogue and digital electronics for embedded control systems
  • Develop new embedded control systems software for 32-bit microcontrollers
  • Debug new and existing electronic/electrical systems in product and in development environment
  • Design and develop electrical systems including power management and distribution
  • Support idea generation and problem resolution through day-to-day working and structured Design Reviews
  • Work closely with Engineering Analysts (FEA)/ Engineering team to meet design targets and drive the most cost-effective solutions
  • Work closely with Manufacturing to agree feasible manufacturing solutions and to control the engineering change process
  • Communicate with your Lead Engineer to ensure you have the necessary level of support and help when required
  • PCB Layout and design
  • Electrical system design and build
  • Full cycle product design and support
  • Manage documentation as part of change management process for existing systems
  • Specify test plans for developed systems
  • Complete design verification and function sign off in line with project deadlines.

Essential Skills

  • Electronics/Electrical Engineering degree or equivalent within a relevant subject
  • Analogue and digital electronics design
  • Familiar with 32-bit processors/micro-controllers
  • C / C++
  • A good technical understanding of electrical / electronic systems
  • Analytical and logical mind with numeracy and literacy skills
  • Use of Microsoft packages – Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint
  • Strong communication skills both verbal and written
  • Engineering design knowledge
  • Understanding importance of engineering change requests
  • Excels in organisational skills and time management
  • A drive to learn and improve at every opportunity
  • Professional attitude and ability to work in multi-discipline teams
  • Discipline to follow technical and administrational procedures

Desirable Skills

  • Master’s degree
  • Industry Experience
  • Microchip PIC/ ARM cortex processors and development toolchain
  • Understanding of CAD and CAE Literacy
  • Familiar with communication buses (CAN, LIN, I2C, SPI, etc.)
  • Designing to MISRA guidelines
  • Matlab/Simulink/Stateflow trained
  • Python
  • Understanding of PCB Design and layout
  • Awareness of ISO26262

Please note we do not provide sponsorships to those who require it and will only accept applications from those who have full rights to work in the UK with no restrictions and IDLR status. Please provide status on applications.

Our inclusive workplace welcomes and values all candidates from all backgrounds, we believe that diversity enhances our ability to innovate and serve our customers effectively. We are an equal opportunity employer and strive to create an environment where everyone feels respected, supported, and able to bring their authentic selves to work. If you require any reasonable adjustments to participate in the recruitment process, please let us know, and we will do our best to accommodate your needs.

title: Business Analyst
description:
Summary

Job Reference:
224348BR

Nottingham Support Office

Permanent

37.5 hours per week

Our application process

An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Business Analyst, as a member of the Retail and Supply IT Development team within Boots IT. Reporting to a Lead Business Analyst, you will be responsible for working with members of the Retail and Supply Chain functions to jointly define with them the high-level scope, objectives and requirements for some major upcoming projects in those areas.

Who we are

Boots IT & Advanced Analytics

IT is at the centre of what we do.

This is retail IT for the real world, you’re so close to your customers in all ways – in store, online and internally.

You can get involved with all the different areas of our business, working on projects that make a real difference – from our hugely important in-store systems to our world-class forecasting, replenishment, warehousing and order management systems.
We place so much value on our IT team – if you want to build a career that will keep developing with your skills, there’s no better place to do it.

Boots UK is the UK’s leading pharmacy-led health and beauty retailer. With around 2000 stores in the UK and Ireland, our purpose is to help our customers look and feel better than they ever thought possible. You can learn more by visiting boots.jobs

Diversity, equity and inclusion is at the centre of everything we do in our business. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, passionate about embracing the diversity of our colleagues and providing a positive and inclusive working environment for all.

About the role
As a BA within Boots IT and Advanced Analytics, you will have these specific responsibilities:

  • Building enduring relationships with the business areas, favouring strong collaborative interactions over processes and documentation
  • Facilitating the analysis and user story creation for projects and programmes
  • Ensuring that user stories are sized to an appropriate level of detail, with all acceptance tests agreed
  • For larger projects and programmes, staying involved with the project right through to delivery and implementation, Ensuring that the user acceptance phase fully tests that the solution meets the requirements
  • Bringing a BA approach/methodology to wider departmental initiatives and ad hoc investigations

What you’ll need to have
The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate:
  • A natural curiosity that drives them to really want to understand the business process to which the solution is to be applied
  • An ability to get to the real nub of the issue, beyond how the problem is first described
  • That they are comfortable to challenge the perceived wisdom and request evidence (facts and data) to support what they are being told
  • A track record of bringing clarity of thought to complex and potentially initially vague situations
  • Good relationship-building skills
  • Evidence of over five years of experience of using industry best practise BA tools and techniques
  • A good all-round appreciation of how IT is leveraged in successful UK Retail companies

It would be great if you also have
  • Experience in leading the pre delivery requirements stage of a project that is subsequently delivered by a third party software house

Hybrid Working – 3 days in office, 2 days from home

We currently operate a fixed hybrid working approach for Support Office team members with a mix of remote and office-based working. Our set office days are Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday with team members able to work remotely if they wish on Mondays and Fridays.

Our benefits
  • Boots Retirement Savings Plan
  • Generous employee discount plus enhanced discounts for Boots brands, Boots Opticians and Boots Hearingcare
  • Excellent onsite facilities including staff shop, opticians (including free eye tests for team members), gym, cafeteria and outdoor seating

We have a great range of benefits in addition to the above that go beyond salary and offer flexibility to suit you;(all rewards and benefits are subject to change and eligibility).

In joining Boots IT & Advanced Analytics (IT2A) you will be able to access: The WBA IT Academy, BCS up to the level of fellow, the ISF for professional development in the Cyber Security and Information Governance arena, HIMSS for certification in the use of digital healthcare, CHIME for globally recognised qualification in the delivery of digital healthcare. Additionally, a series of internal capabilities are also available to all members of the team including regular connections to the full team, delivering change through technology at Boots. The team ethos is one of shared learning and the team will support attendance at public learning throughout the UK and the onward sharing of this within the team.

Boots IT2A has a well-established diversity, equity and inclusion model and charter known as Inclusive IT that strives to make allies of everyone who works within the team. This job role is one which could be performed on a part-time or full-time basis.



What’s next?

If your application is successful, our recruitment team will be in touch to arrange an interview and to answer any initial questions you have. If you have not been successful on this occasion, you will be notified by email.

We are always open to discussing possible flexible working options and what this may look like for you, including job share and reduced hours. If you require additional support as part of the application and interview process, we are happy to provide reasonable adjustments to enable you to be at your best.

title: Laboratory Analyst
description:
An opportunity has arisen for a Senior Analyst in the General Microbiology 1 team at ALS Environmental in Coventry, West Midlands.

As a Senior Analyst you will deputise for the Team Leader in their absence and provide support to the analytical team.

About the Position
Hours Per Week: 37
Days Per Week: Night shift role, working days TBC, working hours likely to be 23:00 – 07:00
Contract: Full Time and Permanent
Annual Salary: £24,365

Specific Accountabilities & Key Performance Indicators:
  • Ensure all samples completed in compliance with quality management system
  • Ensure all samples completed to allocated quantities and deadlines
  • Maintain daily service delivery to Company KPI’s
  • Interpretation and reporting of analytical data
Position Duties and Scope:
  • Daily supervision of analysts in the absence of the Team Leader providing adequate support, supervision and instruction to enable staff to fulfil their roles
  • Support the Team Leader in planning and organising the team’s daily work and run team meetings
  • Support the Team Leader in managing resources to meet service delivery targets
  • Train colleagues to required standard, assess & ensure ongoing competency
  • Providing relevant information to customer services
  • Deal with customer complaints & queries
  • Work with other team members to ensure efficient flow of samples
  • Investigate and report on non-conforming work
  • Demonstrate analytical problem solving skills.
  • Monitor and reduce rework to statistical minimum
Occupational Health & Safety Responsibilities:
  • Adhere to Health and Safety and Company policies and procedures
  • Proactively raise Health and Safety issues
  • To work with the Team Leader to improve the safety, environment and general health of the staff
  • To comply with the Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) requirements
  • To report any near-misses or incident to the line manager
Position Requirements
  • Minimum HNC/HND or equivalent in a relevant subject
  • Significant laboratory experience and in-depth knowledge of environmental testing
  • Problem solving skills
  • Good organisational skills with the ability to prioritise your own work and others in the team
  • Attention to detail and the ability to keep accurate records
  • Good communication
  • Good IT skills
  • Comprehensive understanding of Quality Management System
  • Evaluate critically and draw conclusions from scientific and other data
Employee Benefits Include:
  • Annual Leave commencing at 25 days (rising to 30) plus 8 public holidays (pro rata for part time)
  • Ability to Buy annual leave.
  • Enhanced Company Sick Pay Scheme
  • Salary Progression Scheme based on technical and behavioural competencies.
  • ‘Celebrating Success’ Recognition Awards
  • Perkbox membership providing access to discount vouchers and wellness hub.
  • Learning/study support
  • Group Personal Pension Plan
  • Car Parking on-site
Please note there is NO visa or sponsorship support provided for this role.

This is an excellent opportunity for a motivated and skilled person, who is focused on providing excellent service to our clients, to develop their career in an international company.

INDMP

title: General Ledger Accountant
description:

title: Graduate Hydrogeologist
description:
Graduate Hydrogeologist

Envireau Water has an exciting opportunity for a Graduate Hydrogeologist to join our Team in Melbourne, Derbyshire.

It's about making an impact.

Are you looking for a role and a company where you can grow a brilliant career? At Envireau Water, we are known for doing things differently. We love a complex challenge, and we excel at finding new ways to solve problems. Our clients certainly value our expertise, but we are told they love working with us too!

Life at Envireau Water is hardworking, fast moving, and varied. You will be working on an everchanging range of projects as part of a diverse technical team, with no two weeks the same. You will be learning to and completing both field and office based technical activities, supporting the wider team to deliver technical and regulatory solutions for our clients across the UK.

Your day-to-day activities will include the design and installation of monitoring systems, analysis, and interpretation of hydrometric data from a wide range of sources, geological map interpretation, and production of conceptual models.

What we are looking for

  • An MSc in hydrogeology, geology, hydrology, or a related subject.
  • Proficiency with the MS Office suite, especially Excel and Word.
  • Demonstrable GIS skills.
  • Confidence to work in both field and office environments.

We are looking for people who will thrive in a fast paced, and supportive environment. What would make you a great fit for us?

  • A positive, self-starting, and flexible attitude with a real interest in learning and growth.
  • A desire to get stuck in quickly and apply expertise in a pragmatic way.
  • A passion for building great relationships with colleagues and clients alike.

You will be able to access comprehensive learning and development and a range of impressive benefits. We think we have the best of both worlds; we are an agile boutique consultancy, and we are also part of the global RSK Group with access to a wide range of resources and market strength.

The Package

  • A salary in the region of £25,000 to £30,000 with a higher salary potentially negotiable.
  • Permanent contract, working 40 hours per week within Monday to Friday.
  • A hybrid working pattern is encouraged with flexible start and finish times and family friendly working arrangements available.
  • Performance based individual bonus scheme.
  • 35 days annual leave including bank holidays and an annual leave purchase scheme.
  • Contributory private pension.
  • Private medical insurance, including dental and optical benefits.
  • Discounted gym memberships.
  • Income protection and life cover.
  • Cycle to work and electric vehicle schemes.
  • Volunteering and numerous team away days.
  • Retirement and mortgage advice.

If this opportunity speaks to you, we would love to hear more about you and what you might bring to the business.

#Water #rskfamily #recruitment

RSK will not accept unsolicited CVs from agencies other than RSK PSL or Secondary agencies


We are a close-knit, client-focused firm of water scientists and engineers. Our core services cover industrial and private water supplies, flood risk management, and drainage and water treatment. We have forged close working relationships with private individuals and national and global businesses, including DIAGEO, Nestle, Astra Zeneca, Bellway Homes, Associated British Ports, and Elveden Estates. Our merging with RSK will enable both companies to rely on mutual expertise and greatly expand our hydrogeology and hydrology capabilities. Envireau Water will continue to deliver the excellent service they are known for while also exploring new opportunities across the public sector.

Envireau Water was founded in 1998 and operates throughout Ireland and the UK. Our team, incorporating water specialists and academics, works collaboratively with clients to find robust, cost-effective solutions to complex water problems, keeping sustainability and quality at the forefront of every result.

Envireau Water is part of the RSK Group, a leading integrated environmental, engineering, and technical services business providing dynamic, multidisciplinary services to a wide range of sectors. RSK was founded in 1989 and has grown considerably since then. In fact, Environment Analyst recently highlighted RSK’s growth commenting, “Few companies in the environmental services sector can claim to be expanding at the same pace as RSK.”

RSK operates as a group of synergistic businesses with a growth strategy centred on diversification to build a resilient business that can withstand external pressures while also bringing more value to clients and opportunities to employees.

  • Ensure compliance with relevant accounting standards, regulations, and internal control procedures.
  • Assist in the preparation of financial statements, audits, and tax filings as required.
Decision Support:
  • Provide financial insights, analyses, and recommendations to support strategic decision-making, resource allocation, and performance improvement initiatives.
  • Collaborate with department heads and executives to evaluate the financial viability of new programs, services, and investments.


Skills, Knowledge and Expertise


  • Qualified accountant with at least 3 years post qualified experience.
  • Proven experience as a Management Accountant or Financial Analyst.
  • Proficiency in financial modeling, forecasting, and budgeting techniques.

title: Finance Partner
description:
We have an excellent opportunity for a Finance Business Partner to join our Finance team based in our Nottingham office.

Potter Clarkson LLP is one of the leading pan-European Intellectual Property law firms, with seven offices across the UK, Denmark, Sweden and Germany.

We offer clients a full IP service to support them in achieving their commercial objectives. We pride ourselves in the exceptional level of client care offered by our approachable and engaged team.

We have over 90 patent and trade mark professionals and 10 IP solicitors, who are expertly assisted by over 130 support staff and state of the art IT infrastructure.

The firm is consistently ranked in the top tier of major legal guides, such as Legal 500 and MIP. We also hold three independent ISO accreditations which evidence our high level of environmental awareness, service provision and information security.

We are committed to promoting a healthy work-life balance, and supporting the wellbeing of all our people. We offer a wealth of health and wellbeing benefits and resources including healthcare, attractive flexible working options, sports and social groups, virtual mindfulness sessions, a virtual wellbeing hub, mental health first aiders, and a busy social calendar.

The Role

The Finance Business Partner, will provide insight and analysis to drive commercial decisions. They will ensure, whilst directing the Commercial Finance Analyst, that management information is accurate, delivered on a timely basis and is sufficiently granular to support review and decision making at the fee earning department and office levels.

To support the Head of Finance and CFO by providing key metrics and analysis to enable improved operational and strategic business decisions. Working closely with the fee earning teams to ensure a good understanding of the key drivers to improve performance and profitability.


Duties and Responsibilities

  • To work closely with fee earning teams to ensure they have sufficient information to drive good commercial decisions and to develop their understanding of financial metrics and KPIs through coaching. Challenge appropriately as necessary. Have a strong oversight of each team’s main areas of profitability, key clients and team structure.
  • Responsible for the preparation of budgets and forecasts for income and costs for their respective fee earning teams.
  • Ensure the timely delivery of monthly reporting to their fee earning teams and support production of the management information pack.
  • To understand the components and drivers of income, including both time billed and other/disbursement income, and provide back to the business insights on variances to budget/prior year and opportunities for profitable growth.
  • To work with large volumes of data, highlighting any inconsistencies or inaccuracies and creating meaningful and insightful information presented in a variety of formats to suit the audience.
  • Work closely with the Head of Finance and CFO to deliver financial information for strategy and board using a variety of presentational aids.
  • To develop the Commercial Finance Analyst.
  • To take on ad hoc duties as and when they arise including high level cover for the Head of Finance during periods of absence.

Requirements

Technical

  • Advanced Excel skills including pivot tables, logic formulas and look ups.
  • Excellent knowledge of Microsoft packages including Outlook, Word and PowerPoint.
  • Relevant qualification and experience i.e. ACCA/ACA/CIMA.
  • Excellent systems knowledge.
  • Experience of working within a changing and dynamic finance environment undertaking a broad range of finance tasks and responsibilities.
  • Working within a professional services sector is desirable.


Personal

  • Excellent time management and organisation skills required. The ability to prioritise work is essential.
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to influence decision making. To be professional at all times and build good working relationships.
  • Flexible and adaptable in approach with an enquiring mind to challenge appropriately where necessary.
  • Process driven, organised individual who excels at meeting deadlines when working within a busy team environment.
  • Excellent team working ethic to ensure a seamless finance service is provided across the business.
  • Use of initiative when problem solving demonstrating logical and consistency.
  • Demonstrable business acumen and commercial awareness.

Benefits

  • Birthday leave.
  • Flexible working policy.
  • Travel loan scheme.

title: Systems Analyst
description:
Equip Outdoor Technologies UK Ltd based in Alfreton, Derbyshire specialise in the design and marketing of technical outdoor clothing and equipment. Our experienced and enthusiastic team develop innovative designs, manufactured to the highest standard and brought to market throughout the world. Equip Outdoor Technologies own and operate two leading aspirational outdoor brands, Rab and Lowe Alpine. For further information on Equip please visit our website at www.equipuk.com


Our team is based at our Head Office just outside The Peak District National Park off jct28 of the M1 corridor.



Position:

We are at the cusp of an exciting era, transitioning our current ERP (NAV 2017) to Business Central over a two-year project. Our aim is to provide a modern platform that empowers users to excel in their roles and sets the foundation for business growth over the next decade.


We are seeking a positive individual who can contribute ideas and technical skills, assist with project planning and manage workloads to help deliver this transition. You will also collaborate with the Head of IT and Systems on general business improvements as directed by the company’s Directors.


Once Business Central is implemented, this role will shift towards support and continuous improvement - exploring what we can do now and how we can do it better. This will be a dynamic, fast-paced role in a constantly evolving business. While no programming knowledge is required (as our BC MS partner handles development), scoping projects, testing and planning, in conjunction with the Head of IT and Systems, will be key aspects of this role.


Key Responsibilities of IT System Analyst Business Central (including but not limited to):

  • Initially, to assist in the implementation and transition to Business Central (BC), working in collaboration with our Microsoft Partner to create comprehensive documentation for the new system. This will serve as a ‘system bible’ for end-users, complete with video tutorials and text content.
  • In the initial phase, testing of the newly developed system processes in Business Central. These processes may either be upgraded from Nav 2017 or newly created within BC. During this testing phase, to collaborate closely with key users.
  • Implement and maintain a comprehensive understanding of the new platform, which will present opportunities for learning and contribution as we continue to evolve this platform.
  • Continuously strive for improvement by questioning existing processes and utilising available tools to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.


Requirements:

To join us as IT System Analyst Business Central you must have:

Essential:

  • Experience of implementing Business Central as part of a team, significant experience in Business Central or a high level of experience in a previous similar version (Dynamics Nav)
  • IT degree or equivalent qualification
  • Experience of using Microsoft Office suite including Word, Excel, Outlook
  • Able to work effectively as part of a team as well as use own initiative
  • Effective communication skills at all levels
  • General professional and can-do attitude
  • Effective organisational skills with the ability to prioritise workloads and meet deadlines
  • Current full driving licence

Desirable:

  • Jet Reports experience
  • Power platform


Other information:

Benefits:

  • Competitive salary commensurate with qualifications, skills and experience
  • Contributory company pension scheme
  • Life Assurance Scheme
  • Hybrid working (discretionary basis, determined by business need) as well as an early finish on Fridays!
  • Employee Wellbeing Programme
  • Free, unlimited access to LinkedIn Learning training resources
  • Great staff discounts on our Rab and Lowe Alpine products
  • Reciprocal trade discounts on climbing, bikes, camping, sailing and running equipment
  • Casual dress code
  • Modern office facilities with free on-site parking and we are proud to be a climate neutral company


Closing date for applications is 19 February 2024


For general enquiries please contact: recruitment@equipuk.com


Strictly No Agencies please


Our people are part of one team that is geared to achieving success for the company, and we are strongly committed to inclusivity, promoting equality and celebrating diversity among our staff.

We are looking for people who are passionate about and can help live our values of

Synergy, Ingenuity, Ambition, Determination and Integrity.

title: Purchase Ledger Clerk
description:
Join an innovative and expanding business based in Leicestershire as a Senior Accounts Payable Clerk, bringing your expertise to our dynamic finance team. This is a temporary to permanent role with competitive compensation, providing a stable and rewarding opportunity for the right candidate.

Details:

· Office Based

· Salary Up To £27,000

· Temporary to Permanent Vacancy

The Role & Your Responsibilities:

  • Maintain strong internal control within the Purchase Ledger function.
  • Efficiently match supplier invoices to purchase orders, accurately input credit notes into the system.
  • Manage and update supplier details, including account openings.
  • Post cash book entries to the Purchase Ledger, allocating direct debits effectively.
  • Address internal and external queries related to purchase invoices and supplier payments.

  • Guarantee accuracy in the purchase ledger and request supplier documentation when necessary.
  • Assess outstanding purchase orders, resolving any discrepancies.
  • Collaborate with budget holders to facilitate timely order closures and accurate receipt dates for accrual purposes.

Experience Sought in the Successful Candidate:

  • Minimum of two years' experience in a Purchase Ledger environment, covering all aspects of Purchase Ledger and Supplier account administration.
  • Strong customer service orientation with the ability to build effective relationships with employees and external stakeholders/suppliers.
  • Effective team player with the capability to thrive in a collaborative environment and meet deadlines consistently.

title: Technical Security Threat Intelligence Officer
description:
Full-time
    Employee Status: Regular
    Role Type: Home
    Department: Information Technology & Systems
    Schedule: Full Time

Company Description

Discover the Unexpected

Experian is the world’s leading global information services company. We’re passionate about unlocking the power of data in order to transform lives and create opportunities for consumers, businesses and society. For more than 125 years, we’ve helped economies and communities flourish – and we’re not done.

Our 21k amazing employees in 40+ countries believe the possibilities for you, and the world, are growing. We’re investing in the future, through new technologies, talented people and innovation so we can help create a better tomorrow. To do this we employ the brightest minds that share our purpose and want to make a difference.

Job Description

Experian's Cyber Fusion Centre (CFC) is designed to leverage the best technology with our highly trained security experts to detect and investigate cyber security attacks and insider threats around the world. Experian CFC is seeking a Global Head of Threat Intelligence to lead a global program and drive efforts that promote timely and actionable threat intelligence information.

This is an incredible opportunity to be part of a world class organization and lead a global team of highly skilled and innovative people to help us stay ahead of adversaries. The team focuses on defending against emerging threats, supporting investigations, and delivering situational awareness to the business.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Lead a global threat intelligence team (cyber and physical) including operations, services, products, and capabilities.
  • Perform global presentations on CFC activities and threat intelligence.
  • Oversee processes and procedures for information collection, analysis, and dissemination with a focus on the development, tracking and reporting of threat intelligence metrics and KPI’s to senior leadership.
  • Partner with business units and key stakeholders around the globe to deliver intelligence products and services.
  • Coordinate and collaborate with industry partners, external agencies, and law enforcement.
  • Drive use cases to enable threat detection and hunting based on threat intelligence frameworks (e.g., MITRE)

Qualifications

Requirements

  • Demonstrable experience in cyber focused threat intelligence or information security role
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills. Must be able brief to various audiences and conveying highly technical information in a clear, concise manner.
  • Fluent with the Cyber Kill Chain Model, Diamond Model, Course of Action Matrix, and/or MITRE ATT&CK Matrix, and consistently uses the methodologies/frameworks during intelligence gathering and analysis activities.
  • Ability to lead intelligence activities during incident response; strong understanding of the incident response process, and ability to identify areas of relevance for intelligence collection and/or application.
  • Must have experience mentoring analysts in particular on how to spot anomalies and patterns, conduct link analysis, and draw relevance to the enterprise

Additional Information

Our uniqueness is that we truly celebrate yours.

Experian's culture and people are key differentiators. We take our people agenda very seriously. We focus on what truly matters; DEI, work/life balance, development, authenticity, engagement, collaboration, wellness, reward & recognition, volunteering... the list goes on. We’re an award winning organisation due to our strong people first approach.

Innovation is a critical part of Experian's DNA and practices, and our diverse workforce drives our success. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

description:
An IT Business Analyst, or Business Analyst analyses computers and software used by an organisation. Their primary duties include determining which installations and upgrades will make processes and employees more productive, performing a cost/benefit analysis and aligning technology with the goals and business strategies of the organisation.
